description: The story follows the Kirihara brothers who from a young age were incarcerated in a secure scientific facility due to their supernatural powers, having escaped after the barrier that was preventing them malfunctions. The story also follows the Kuroki brothers who are trying to chase the Kirihara brothers.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

node.description: George Iida is a Japanese film and television director, screenwriter, manga author, and novelist. Iida has worked continually in Japan's film, television, anime and manga industries since the early 1980s; predominantly in the genres of horror and science fiction.

George Iida is a Japanese film and television director, screenwriter, manga author, and novelist. Iida has worked continually in Japan's film, television, anime and manga industries since the early 1980s; predominantly in the genres of horror and science fiction.
**Hirakawa Takamitsu (平川孝充)** is a Japanese CG director and episode director.

George Iida is a Japanese film and television director, screenwriter, manga author, and novelist. Iida has worked continually in Japan's film, television, anime and manga industries since the early 1980s; predominantly in the genres of horror and science fiction.

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.

Tomiyasu Ken'ichirou is a Japanese concept artist and art director. He is the representative director of INEI.

(Source: AnidB)

name.native: フーヤエクステンデッド

node.description:
[Website](https://www.wyxt.info/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/wyxt_official) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3sE3971KYAw7t9ENx8Eqwk)

__Introduction:__
Who-ya Extended is a Japanese creative unit centered around the vocalist フーヤ (Who-ya).

__Biography:__
The unit first debuted in anime by performing the opening theme song titled "[Qvism](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zo5Q5ea1WDw)" in the TV anime [Psycho-Pass 3](https://anilist.co/anime/108307/PSYCHOPASS-3/), which started broadcasting on Fuji TV's "noitaminA" television block on October 24, 2019. A month later the unit made their major debut by releasing a full version of the single.

The unit would soon reappear in the sequel movie [Psycho-Pass 3: First Inspector](https://anilist.co/anime/113917/PSYCHOPASS-3-First-Inspector-/), with a brand new single titled "[Synthetic Sympathy](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9PRpTiZvco)". The full version of the song was released and available for digital purchase on March 9, 2020.

(Source; [Who-ya Extended's Official Website](https://www.wyxt.info/profile/), edited)
**Takahashi Kazuhiko (高橋和彦)** is a Japanese director of photography.
**Minoru Oonishi** is a Japanese art director and art designer.
**Ryuu Sakamoto** is a Japanese art designer and background artist.
**Hakuta Masato (白田真人)** is a Japanese art director, art designer and concept artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/myukmusic) | [YouTube](https://youtube.com/c/myukmusic) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/myukmusic/)

__Birthplace:__ Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan

Miyu Kumagawa is a Japanese singer, songwriter, and lyricist. Miyu's songs are mostly inspired by western music artists like Ed Sheeran and Taylor Swift. In the beginning of her career, she started producing music mainly on acoustic guitar and perform mostly covers on services like Spotify or J-WAVE. In the end of 2020, she started her solo music project "Myuk", and under this name, she and composer EVE prepared the first song for the anime series _Yakusoku no Neverland Season 2_.

The name "Myuk" comes from the Swedish word "Mjuk", which means "gentleness," and her real name (Miyu K).
